intro: Tetragonanthus brevicornis, commonly known as the narrow-horned tetragonanthus, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its small, four-angled stems and clusters of yellowish-white flowers. Its leaves are typically ovate with a smooth surface and are arranged alternately along the stem. Tetragonanthus brevicornis is often found in shaded, moist environments such as forest understories.
